info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 11 at 9:36PM PST until March 13 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM PST SATURDAY TO 11 AM PDT SUNDAY ABOVE 5000 FEET... * WHAT...Moderate snow expected above 5000 feet elevation. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 9 inches. Winds gusting 30 to 40 mph in exposed areas. * WHERE...Higher mountains above 5000 feet in the Southern and South Central Oregon Cascades for areas north of highway 140. This includes portions of highways 62, 232, 230 and 138 near Crater Lake and Diamond Lake. * WHEN...From 4 PM PST Saturday to 5 AM PDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Periods of heavy snowfall rates of 1 inch per hours are possible, mainly late Saturday evening and late Saturday night into early Sunday morning. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
